page.title: 06MILK DISTRIBUTION
page.content: The cows file into the parlour where the udders are carefully wiped with individual tissues. A little of the milk is examined before milking starts properly. When milking is finished the teats automatically disconnect. The milk used to be taken round the village and sold. The herd was tuberculin tested but the milk was not pasteurised. As sales dropped this was not considered profitable. Milk is still sold by Bluegates dairy but it comes from a Cambridgeshire Dairy. Milk is warmer than human blood it is stored in the large refrigerated stainless steel containers, collected by tanker and taken to Letchworth five miles away to be bottled and sold. Pasteurisation is now economical on a small scale so it is possible that Ashwell will again drink its own milk.
